definition: the act of finishing, cause to finish a relationship with somebody
details:
noun
- the act of finishing
= example: the act of finishing
= synonyms: finishing
- a decorative texture or appearance of a surface, or the substance that gives it that appearance
= example: a decorative texture or appearance of a surface, or the substance that gives it that appearance
= synonyms: finishing, coating
- (wine tasting) the taste of a wine on the back of the tongue (as it is swallowed)
= example: (wine tasting) the taste of a wine on the back of the tongue (as it is swallowed)
- event whose occurrence ends something
= synonyms: conclusion
- the downfall of someone (as of persons on one side of a conflict)
= example: the downfall of someone (as of persons on one side of a conflict)
- designated event that concludes a contest (especially a race)
= example: designated event that concludes a contest (especially a race)
- the place designated as the end (as of a race or journey)
= example: the place designated as the end (as of a race or journey)
= synonyms: goal
- a highly developed state of perfection
= synonyms: culture, cultivation, refinement, polish
- the temporal end
= synonyms: conclusion
verb
- cause to finish a relationship with somebody
= example: cause to finish a relationship with somebody
- finally be or do something
= synonyms: finish up, land up, fetch up, end up, wind up
- come or bring to a finish or an end
= example: come or bring to a finish or an end
= synonyms: complete
- finish eating all the food on one's plate or on the table
= synonyms: polish off, eat up
- provide with a finish
= example: provide with a finish
- have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense
= synonyms: end, stop, cease, terminate
